alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 1:51PM CDT until July 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County. For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Crooked Creek Near Englewood. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Prepare for minor inundations of one or more feet along the Crooked Creek in southern Meade County as floodwaters leave the main channel and moves out onto the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CDT Saturday was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 6.9 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 07/27/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
